cassiopy.stats.Skew.pdf#

The pdf method calculates the probability density function of the skew-t distribution.

cassiopy.stats.Skew.pdf(x, mu, sigma, nu, lamb)#

Probability density fonction

Parameters:

  • x (float) – The input data.

  • mu (float) – The mean.

  • sigma (float) – The standard deviation.

  • nu (float) – The degree of freedom.

  • lamb (float) – The skewness.

Returns:

proba – The probability of the data.

Return type:

float

References

[1] Adelchi Azzalini, Antonella Capitanio, Distributions Generated by Perturbation of Symmetry with Emphasis on a Multivariate Skew t-Distribution, Journal of the Royal Statistical Society Series B: Statistical Methodology, Volume 65, Issue 2, May 2003, Pages 367–389.

Notes

For more information, refer to the documentation Stats

Example

>>> from cassiopy.stats import Skew
>>> sm = Skew()
>>> x, mu, sigma, nu, lamb = 0.5, 0, 1, 10, 0.5
>>> sm.pdf(x, mu, sigma, nu, lamb)
0.3520653267642995
